definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)

sentences.english: For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side.
sentences.chinese: 我听见了许多人的谗谤，四围都是惊吓。

sentences.english: The foolish fox was frightened and fell in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 那只愚蠢的狐狸受到惊吓，躲在了树林里。

sentences.english: Puss was startled for a moment.
I am sorry. I was too shock to do so.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，我当时惊吓过度以至于没有留意到。

sentences.english: The frightened children were clustered together.
sentences.chinese: 受惊吓的小孩子们缩在一块。

sentences.english: When disturbed, the fish inflates itself and becomes globular in form.
sentences.chinese: 当河豚鱼受到惊吓时，它会将自己膨胀成球状。

sentences.english: Terrified animals attacks prisoners chained to posts or bound up with fresh meat.
sentences.chinese: 受到惊吓的野兽攻击锁在柱上或绑上鲜肉的囚犯。

sentences.english: If you enjoy the feeling of being scared, you will love this film.
sentences.chinese: 如果你喜欢受惊吓的感觉，你会喜欢这部电影。

sentences.english: If it suddenly startles you in your walk, I will step aside and take another path.
sentences.chinese: 如果在你走路时会惊吓到你，我就移开脚步走别的路。

sentences.english: Don't be so easily frightened, you are a big boy now.
sentences.chinese: 你已成大孩子了，不要那样容易受惊吓。

sentences.english: Nude-hiking advocates say they aren't out to startle people.
sentences.chinese: 裸体远足倡导者称，他们没有惊吓别人的企图。

sentences.english: Horses have a well-developed instinct for fear.
There are some things pigs actually automatically don't like, like being hit or shocked.
sentences.chinese: 有些东西是猪天生就不喜欢的，比如挨打或受到惊吓。

sentences.english: I was in shock, blood fountaining out of me as I struggled for breath.
sentences.chinese: 我是在惊吓中，泉离我的血当我为呼吸努力。

sentences.english: The invaders' war elephants bolted, killing vast numbers of soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 侵略者的战象受惊吓而狂奔，踩死了大量士兵。

definition: to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
